fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1800].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Jira Portfolio shows invalid entry for a date written in language different then English since Portfolio does not support I18n as of now.

h3. Environment
Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the *Due Date* field of an issue from the Portfolio plan
# For example, in German, enter *15/Mai/17* in the field 

h3. Expected Results
The date is saved

h3. Actual Results
Date shows as invalid 
 
h3. Notes
This works as expected in JIRA 

h3.Workaround
Use the date picker to select the date. The date will be saved in English, for example *15/May/17*
Type in the date in English
fields.summary: Jira Potfolio shows invalid entry for a date when language is different then English

h2. Problem

When a plan contains issue sources that are based on JQLs (e.g., _issueType in (Epic, Story) ORDER BY Rank_) from which the project ID cannot be derived directly, the following error might be thrown when navigating from the versions selection to the issue selection step in the plan setup wizard:

fields.summary: Plan setup wizard might throw exception when navigating from the versions to issues step
Set Skills on Issues
Feature to see a user's overall capacity (not just per plan)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1794].
  {panel}

h4. Summary

The same behavior can be observed with the *Parent Link* Field:
* {{com.atlassian.jpo.env.issues.JiraIssueService}}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Very poor performance on the project picker dropdown when there are over 3500 projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy a new JIRA instance and install Portfolio.
# Use this script to generate 4000 projects, filling the values at the top prior to running it.
{code:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
#!/bin/bash
PROJECTS=4000
JIRA_BASE_URL="http://ecrmac-632.local:54593/PS-9149"
JIRA_USER="admin"
JIRA_PASSWORD="sphere"

for p in $(seq $PROJECTS); do
    echo -n "Creating project $p of $PROJECTS: "
    PKEY=$(LC_CTYPE=C tr -dc A-Z < /dev/urandom | fold -w ${1:-6} | head -n 1)
    curl -u $JIRA_USER:$JIRA_PASSWORD \
       --header "Content-Type:application/json" \
       -X POST \
       -d "{ \"key\": \"$PKEY\", \"name\": \"$PKEY\", \"projectTypeKey\": \"business\", \"lead\": \"$JIRA_USER\" }" \
       $JIRA_BASE_URL/rest/api/2/project
    echo
done
{code}
# Grab a coffee, this will take a while.
# Navigate to *Portfolio > Create plan*.
# Enter any plan name and hit *Next*.
# Switch to *Project* on the left dropdown then start typing to search for a project.

h3. Expected Results
Project picker dropdown performs fast like the user picker.

h3. Actual Results
All projects are loaded into the dropdown, taking a long time to render and being generally unresponsive.
 
h3. Notes
* This slowness also happens on JIRA's issue search page, albeit less noticeably, as reported on JRA-63784.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Poor performance on project picker when there are over 3500 projects

h3. Problem Description

User has the following scenario:
# Within one plan, there is a team with 2 members

# 1 Story with 2 hours estimation and its 3 Subtask (A, B and C) with 1 hour estimation each

When users visit Capacity report, Portfolio assign 4 hours to user one and 1 hour to user two.

h3. Problem Definition
Live plans will be listed on "View All Plans" page and can be viewed by all users that have Portfolio USER or VIEWER permission.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a way to set Plan-level permission during Plan creation wizard with options to have Plan permission required

A user can use any names as Live plan names and this _can_ breach data privacy and legal issue in a multi-tenant instance. Hiding it early during creation is important for this setup.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1773].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When calculating or loading a Portfolio plan memory consumption peaks significantly or even results in an OutOfMemoryError.

h3. How to reproduce
* create a Portfolio plan and enable placeholder scheduling in the configuration
* create a version in JIRA and set a very distant release date
* create an unestimated issue in Portfolio and set this version
* calculate schedule

h3. Workaround
Remove the invalid release date and recalculate.
If the plan can't be loaded anymore the solution has to be removed from the database table AO_D9132D_SOLUTION where the PLAN_ID is the correct one. If necessary also remove the entries from AO_D9132D_ASSIGNMENT with the corresponding SOLUTION_ID.
fields.summary: Excessive memory consumption if there is a version with very distant release date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1772].
  {panel}

The first option in Completion Date scope filter ("completed since the beginning of Open Sprint") seems to be mutually exclusive with all other time-based options (this month, this quarter, specific date interval, etc.)

Customer desires to see Open and Completed issues since specific date e.g. 1 Oct 2016 till now.

We observed that placing an issue into a column in JIRA Software that corresponds to one of the "green" statuses (i.e. status category is 'Done') makes it disappear from Portfolio scope view when this filter is applied. Switching to "open sprint" shows the issue, but then all other previously completed issues disappear.

I understand that there is a similar suggestion JPO-1405 already in the system and I will ask the customer to vote for it, but the original request is slightly different and can be phrased as this:

"When the starting date picked for the filter is before the start of the current sprint, those issues within the current sprint that don't have any resolution set but are in statuses with category 'Done' should be shown."

Also based on the definition of what is considered completed in a certain time period, it seems if an issue doesn't acquire a resolution after the sprint is closed - it won't show up at all, no matter what option is selected.

It seems what is really needed here is a configuration option to identify what date field to take to identify when an issue can be considered completed by a Portfolio plan.

Additionally, If something has been completed in the current sprint and the current sprint started AFTER the date chosen in the Completion filter any logical being would assume that a filter "Completed since October 1st" will catch the issue. Not so for Portfolio. This needs to be fixed.

If marking an issue with a status in "Done" category makes Portfolio treat it as "completed" then the date when the issue first entered this status must be picked up as the date for "Completed since..." filter.
fields.summary: Improve the behaviour of a completed Issue in Portfolio plan

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1769].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, allowing user/group to be part of "Portfolio for JIRA Viewer" permission in Global permission will allow the user to have access to all Live plans. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the setting of Live plans' Viewers permission to be set for certain user/group though they are not part of "Portfolio for JIRA Viewer" permission.

h3. Why this is important
Certain users/groups are limited to seeing projects. Having listed all plans under "View All Plans" allow them to view them but seeing empty issues there due to not having a full "Browse Projects" permission to the projects.

h3. Workaround
Set *both* Viewer and Editor plan-specific permission to a value. This will take precedence over Global permission.

One of the most useful reports in Portfolio is the capacity report.  This is shareable via a link, but none of the raw data, booked, unbooked, utilisation and constraints etc that is available in the clickable popup  for each bar is visible.  

I would really like this information, in order to produce a capacity planning report for the Executive Board.  Please make this information available in a csv/excel export like the scope report.

One other suggestions that I think have already been raised. filter and group by stage so I can see how much capacity is available in test VS development stages.  

 

Expose portfolio data via the API's  so we can extract this data

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1761].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When user clicks _Calculate_ button, Portfolio will get the latest update from JIRA and optimize the plan by automatically assigning Team, releases, etc. As a user, I want to plan my own Sprint, Releases, Team, etc.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to rollback/revert changes after user click Calculate. Or, provide a feature to stop Portfolio from auto assigning/adding Sprint, Team, Releases, etc.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to rollback/revert changes after user click Calculate

h3. Problem Description

# Have some releases which has different start and end dates.
# Have some issues and teams in it.
# Select a team (from the filter) who work on issues from the middle period of the timeline until the end.

h3. Suggested Resolution

h3. Summary 
Changing Issue source doesnt work


h3. Steps to reproduce:

Create Portfolio plan using a Board as a source. 
Select an issue at the plan > Click *Exclude from plan*. 
Plan name  > *Configure* > *Issue Source*
Remove the board from issue source
Re-add the same board > make sure the excluded issue is selected again > *Next*

h3. Expected: 
The issues is added back to the plan

h3. Actual
The issues is not showing in the plan

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Changing Issue source doesnt work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1756].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Portfolio calculates whether a release is overbooked or not by using the issues scheduled for that sprint. As such, when a release is done within a sprint period, the release shows as _Overbooked_ as issues are scheduled for the whole period of the sprint.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Releases to be re-calculated when it is done within a sprint period.

h3. Why this is important
When releases are done within a sprint, users would be able to see that the _Release_ is not overbooked when it is calculated based on capacity.
fields.summary: Re-calculate releases using capacity if it falls within a sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1750].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating a Story within an Epic in Portfolio, if there is the following validator on the create transition:
{quote}If a value for field Epic Link is not provided during the transition, show the following error: Epic LInk must be filled-in.{quote}

The Story creation will fail. In this case with "Epic LInk must be filled-in.":
 !Screen Shot 2016-12-08 at 3.50.15 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The issue should be resolved by setting the *Epic Link* field as required in the _field configuration_. However, it isn't possible to do so since the said field is LOCKED.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.620.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a *Field Required Validator* to the *Create* transition for Stories.
# Within a plan in Portfolio, create a Story under an Epic.
# Commit the changes
# You'll be prompted the _Set required fields_ screen. However, the *Epic Link* isn't listed.

h3. Expected Results
Since the Story is being created from within an Epic, the Epic Link field shouldn't be required to be filled-in.

h3. Actual Results
Story creation fails due to the validator and not having the possibility to fill in the Epic Link field.
 
h3.Workaround
Remove validator, use required field instead.
fields.summary: It isn't possible to create a Story within an Epic if there is a validator requiring Epic Link not be empty
To be able to link to or share a working plan with my specific filters/configurations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1748].
  {panel}

h3. Problem description
Given there is a Live Plan importing issue from a number of different projects and some of these projects need to have strict permission restrictions.
If a user does not have the "Schedule Issue" permission on one of these projects he will be able to "scenario"-rank issues of these projects in the Live Plan, but he won't be able to commit these changes - keeping them forever in the Uncommitted changes list.

h3. Suggestion(s)
One solution would be to provide an option to decouple ranking between JIRA and the Live Plan for one or more issue sources. If issues from these issue sources are ranked these are excluded from committing.
Another would be to introduce a more sophisticated permission scheme for ranking in Portfolio.
A thisd option would be to provide the possibility to ignore certain changes on the commit list (forever).
fields.summary: As a user I want to decouple ranking between Live Plans and JIRA for certain issue sources

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1746].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you assign a member to one or more teams, and the capacity they have for work is fixed to that team. The problem occurs when there is no work for them to do on one of their teams, but that extra capacity is "wasted" because Portfolio does not recognize this capacity could go to the work he does on other teams.

A concrete example of the problem occurs in this situation:
* Member 'Dan'
* Team A and Team B
* Dan is a member of both Team A and B, with a capacity for 100pts a week in each
* Team A is associated with Board A
* Team B is associated with Board B
* There is no work that can be assigned to Board A for Dan, thus his free capacity for work is still 100pts for Team A
* There is a lot of work assigned to Dan from Board B, all 100pts of his Team B capacity is used up
* The free capacity from Board A is not recognized as capacity available for Dan in Team B, bringing his actual capacity to 200pts

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Portfolio to recognized capacity available for a team member dynamically within few Teams.
fields.summary: Allow capacity for a team member to be recognized dynamically between few Teams
Change handling of stories where epic is not included in the plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1744].
  {panel}

*Problem statement*

For large projects, sprint and release dates are quite flexible and may not have a fixed duration length. e.g. for example, in a large organization (400-2000+ developer), the sprints could be by default 4 weeks length but have some exception during xmas period where the sprint is 1 week longer, as a lot of people are on vacation.

Portfolio 1.0 supports this feature with 'Custom Sprints', which allows us to configure a sprint with a length which differs from the default sprint length. However, Porfolio 2.0 does not support this out of box and this prevents any users using custom sprint to migrate from portfolio 1.x to 2.x

[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39440911/how-to-manage-variable-sprint-length-in-portfolio]

 

*Suggestion*

Support custom length sprints in portfolio 2.x
fields.summary: Support custom length sprints in portfolio 2.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1738].
  {panel}

As per all of the comments here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39986944/answers/40347822/comments/43110013

The key concerns for us with the current implementation are:
* It's not possible to use ScriptRunner's JQL functions (or indeed functions from a variety of add ons) to find children of initiatives that meet certain criteria. With a normal link, or even epic link, it is possible to run JQL to find all linked issues where the parent issue meets certain criteria - for enterprise this is absolutely critical. 
* It's not possible to update the field via scripts, it's possible to do this for epic links
* It's not possible to use add ons like Structure to build hierarchies as this isn't a real link type

This basically means the current implementation of the field/JQL is only useful if you want to find the epics linked to known parent initiatives, which only works if you have a small set of initiatives to work with - we have thousands, and cannot currently create a background link to use for searching when a "parent link" is created because we can't access the field value via scripts. 

Please feel free to contact me if you would like more information about our use cases.
fields.summary: Parent link should behave in the same way as epic link (i.e. forming a link in the background)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1734].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

There are some cases where sprints imported into JPO do not match the dates with what is set into Agile. For instance, if you create a sprint with end date to some day after 10:00 PM, when in JPO, the end date will show up as the next day. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.571.2
* JIRA Agile v1000.165.0
* Portfolio for JIRA v2.1.6-OD-002-D20161121T003052

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scrum project/board with a sprint set to start on _01/12 12:00 AM_ and end at _05/12 10:00 PM_
# Create a live plan and import that board
# View the sprint info on the timeline

h3. Expected Results
Sprint info should show that start date is _01/12_ and end date is _05/12_

h3. Actual Results
Sprint info is showing that start date is _01/12_ and end date is _06/12_
 
h3. Notes
This shift only happens if the sprint end date is set to a time after 10:00 PM. The problem does not happen if you set 09:59 PM or any time earlier.
Time may vary depending on the timezone.

h3.Workaround
Change the sprint end date to have a time earlier than 10:00 PM.
fields.summary: Sprint end date shifts one day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Summary
Portfolio scope loses formatting at high zoom settings.
If the user set a high zoom setting in the browser, or a system wide one, specially related with the characters in the text, then the Portfolio Scope will lose formatting:
 !scope.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan with sample issues and hierarchy.
# Use the zoom feature of the browser or the system.

h3. Expected Results
The formatting of the scope should be consistent at high zoom settings.

h3. Actual Results
The formatting is broken as shown in the image above.
 
h3.Workaround
Disable any zoom settings you may have.
fields.summary: Portfolio scope table loses formatting at high zoom settings

h3. Workaround

Set all the teams' iteration lengths to a valid value (iteration length > 0)

To do that go to the "Teams" view and click on the "Scrum" drop down.

Hit Recalculate.
fields.summary: Illegal interval exception when calculating a Portfolio schedule
Force new tickets for specified Issue Sources to go automatically into the Later release

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1729].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Portfolio Restricted User does not Restrict Issue Edits
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user named restricted
 # Create a group named restricted-users and add the restricted user to this group
 # Add restricted-users to the Portfolio Restricted User permission in Portfolio Permissions

h3. Expected Results

Users that are members of the restricted-users group should not be able to edit issues from within a Portfolio Plan
h3. Actual Results

Users from the restricted-users group are still able to edit issues from within a Portfolio Plan including story points
h3. Workaround

Set each Project Permission to exclude *issue edit* permissions for users that should not be able to update issues from Portfolio.
fields.summary: Portfolio Restricted User does not Restrict Issue Edits

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1728].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The New Feature issue type is a Standard issue type. However it is not shown under Stories in the Portfolio Plan if it is part of an Epic.


h3. Environment
Portfolio Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with issues of type *New Feature*
# Add those issues to an Epic
# One *New Feature* issue should not be added to an Epic:
#*  !New feature issue type in Backlog.png|thumbnail!  
# Create a Portfolio Plan (Issue source: the project created)
# The Hierarchy level in Portfolio administration is as following:
#*  !Hierarchy levels.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results
All issues with *New Feature* issue type should be shown in the Portfolio Plan

h3. Actual Results
The issues with *New Feature* issue type are not shown in the Portfolio Plan under Epic. Only the issues which are not part of an Epic are shown.

*  !New feature issue type in Portfolio Plan.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3.Workaround
You can use issue type Story/Bug/Task instead
fields.summary: New feature issue type not shown in Portfolio plan if it is under Epic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1727].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, we do not have a public source code for JIRA Portfolio available for customer to download.

h3. Suggested Solution
Maybe can provide the source code for certain tier of commercial purchased license of JIRA Portfolio.
fields.summary: source code for JIRA Portfolio
Schedule view per week, month and quarter
Team field needs to be multi-select
Make "Team" support "is EMPTY" in JQL
Make "Parent Link" support "is EMPTY" in JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1721].
  {panel}

By assigning a member to an issue, deleting that member from the team/plan, the issue then will still have that member assigned, even though it is not visible. The issue assignee import will now not be able to override this hidden assigned member.

Workaround:
 * Assign a new member to that ticket. Click "Apply"
 * Open up member assignment, click "Clear selected items", then click "Apply"
 * Recalculate
fields.summary: Issues that were assigned a team member who was deleted will not import from JIRA issue assignees

fields.description:
*Problem*

Scenario issues coming from projects that are empty otherwise and that are assigned to a version of that project might not show up in your schedule, even when they are estimated and you recalculate. You will not see a scheduling error on these issues either.

*Workaround*

There is no proper workaround for this issue, upgrade to 2.1.5 to fix this behaviour.
fields.summary: Potential scheduling inconsistencies when a plan's sources reference projects that only contain scenario issues

fields.description:
This error occurs on in the plan create wizard when trying to transition from the "Select Versions" screen.

There are multiple possible causes. It comes down to:
 Any case where we do not have knowledge of component, so we would then seek to retrieve the component using its' ID. This retrieval attempt will fail, causing the error. This would happen in situations were a component that does not exist on in the issue's project is still set on the issue, i.e., the component did not get cleaned up properly when the respective component got deleted from the project or in cases were the issue got moved to a different project. 

Workaround:
 Remove components from issues you have included in your plan (not ideal)
fields.summary: Bummer in plan create on releases screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Capacity is overloaded it is not indicated by the Red overbooked portion as described in:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Using+the+capacity+view
{quote}
You've planned your sprint on the agile board, but the total capacity exceeds the team's velocity. In this case,  the capacity view shows the red overbooked portion.
{quote}

h3. Environment
* JIRA Server 7.2.X and later
* Portfolio 2.1.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up Portfolio Plan that is over capacity
# Calculate plan

h3. Expected Results
Red overbooked portion Shown indicating over allocated resources in plan:
!Screen Shot 2016-11-14 at 2.43.40 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
does not indicate any over allocated resources:
!Screen Shot 2016-11-14 at 2.30.48 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3.NOTES:
- Works in Current JIRA Cloud {{v1000.526.2}} + Portfolio
- Works in JIRA 7.1.X and below + Portfolio {{2.1.3}}

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Overloaded Capacity Not reflected in capacity View

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1717].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

In a portfolio plan, stories are shown nested underneath their parent Epics. When a story is completed and marked as done (and a Resolution is set within JIRA), the story disappears off the plan. 

Users would like the ability to customize or otherwise configure Portfolio so that such completed/resolved stories still remain visible on the board until the entire parent Epic is complete. This is in order to keep the scope of the entire Epic's stories in context.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow for either a Portfolio administration option, or an additional filter option from within Portfolio's planning view, to allow for completed issues with resolution set to still be visible on the plan.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Allow for closed/resolved stories to still be shown on plan when parent Epic is still incomplete

[See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1716]. {panel} h3. Summary JPO is timing out when creating a plan and importing only a few issues from a huge list of possible issues to be imported. h3. Environment Portfolio for JIRA v2.1.5-OD-002-D20161109T020439 h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a board # Add 2000 tickets to this board # Try to create a plan from that board selecting a single issue (or only a couple of them) h3. Expected Results JPO would import only the selected issues. h3. Actual Results JPO is timing out. After a couple of minutes the following error message will show up: {code}Bummer, something has gone terribly wrong here... Please try refreshing the page. If the issue continues, please copy and paste the information in the Details button below and send to your JIRA Administrator or Atlassian Support.{code} {noformat}Unexpected error result. Atlassian Cloud Notifications - Page Unavailable

Loading notifications...

Atlassian
=============== === Request === =============== URL: /rest/jpo/1.0/plans Type: POST Status: 504 =================== === Client Info === =================== User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/54.0.2840.71 Safari/537.36 Local time: Tue Nov 01 2016 14:41:53 GMT-0400 (Eastern Daylight Time) =================== === Plugin Info === =================== Plugin build: 2.1.2-OD-004-D20161018T080005 SEN: Unknown =================== === System Info === =================== JIRA Title: JIRA JIRA Version: 1000.482.3 Agile Version: 1000.135.0 {noformat} h3. Notes When having more than 1000 issues to be possibly added into the scope, if not selecting them while creating the plan, JPO will have to manually (one-by-one) set a property that the issue are excluded from the plan, which is possibly causing the timeout. h3.Workaround # Create plan with all issues and exclude the ones we don't want later: A workaround would be to create the plan with all issues initially and then exclude them from the plan in batches by directly selecting them in the Scope view and committing these changes. # Create filter with the tickets that should be part of plan and use that as Portfolio data source *Downside: losing data association to boards*. Another option is to create a filter in JIRA that only returns the issues you need and to select this as your plans data source. The problem here is that you'll likely lose the main ability of live plans, which is to update the issues in their sources.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1714].
  {panel}

*Problem*

With long running projects, certain versions that were part of my Portfolio Live plan will get archived over time. Consequently, the issues associated with these versions will not show up in the plan anymore (issues assigned to versions hidden from the plan do not show up). I would like to be able to have an option for showing archived versions of a plan, and along with them, the respective issues assigned to them

*Current behaviour*

There is no way to bring back archived versions, my options in looking at them in retrospect are limited

*Expected behaviour*

There is an option that allows me to see archived versions and their issues
fields.summary: As a user, I want to have the option to see archived versions in my Portfolio Live plan

h3. Summary
Accessing JIRA Issue as anonymous user will spam logs with warnings

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure Portfolio is installed in the instance
# Make a project accessIble by anonymous by adding the *Anyone* group to the *Browse Project* permission in the permission scheme for any project.
# Note down the issue key of any issue in the project Eg: SSP-1
# Log out of JIRA
# Access the noted issue directly through the URL. Eg: {{/browse/SSP-1}}
# Check the logs

h3. Expected Results
THe user can access the issue and nothing should appear in the logs

h3. Actual Results
Everytime the anonmous user accesses the issue, then the logs get spammed with the following warning:
{code}
WARN anonymous 1239x891x1 1k22vfz 10.60.9.69 /browse/SSP-1 [c.a.r.j.p.w.children.condition.ChildIssuesPanelVisibilityCondition] Exception when evaluating if child issues panel should be displayed.
{code}
 
h3. Notes
This could be a major issue is there are several users accessing issues anonymously, thereby the logs get flooded with the warnings.
fields.summary: Accessing JIRA Issue as anonymous user will spam logs with warnings
Ability to set stage of work when logging time

  {panel}

h3. Summary
The JIRA Portfolio "Working hours and days" setting is not respecting the Global Time Tracking despite the grayed out value being the one it should be.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud:
Portfolio for JIRA v2.1.2-OD-004

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a new plan with one team
- Change your Time Tracking Global setting to be 5 hours per day. 
- Go to the plan settings in Portfolio: Settings -> Working Hours and Days. It shows a default of 5 hours per day grayed out.
- Add a person to the team in Portfolio
- Notice that under weekly hours it says 40 (even though the default number hours of day = 5 -> 25hrs/week)

h3. Expected Results
The user in the team should have 25h working hours.

h3. Actual Results
The user have 40h.
 
h3. Notes
If you change the number of hours per week in the Portfolio Settings "Working Hours and Days" to 5, the weekly hours changes to 25 in the user on the team, so it behaves as if the actual value of the Workday hours is 8 though the default should be 5.

h3.Workaround
Manually set the Working hours and days in Portfolio plan.
fields.summary: Portfolio Plan not respecting Time Tracking Global Working hours of JIRA.
Ability to specify specify which stages/skills apply to which project or even issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a version is deleted from a project, it causes epics to no longer show up in the "Confirm what's in scope" dialog when creating a plan.

h5. Environment

JIRA 6.4.13
Portfolio 2.1.2, 2.1.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create some epics, and associate them with a Fix Version.
# Create a plan, and noticed that they show up in "Confirm what's in scope".
# Delete that version from Project Administration.
# Create a new plan, and notice that these epics no longer show up, regardless of what versions are selected.

h3. Expected Results

Epics will show up similar to other epics not associated with Fix Versions.

h3. Actual Results

Epics do not appear on the list.
 
h3.Workaround

Cloning the Epics causes them to show up again.
fields.summary: Deleting A Version Causes Epics to Disappear From "Confirm what's in scope"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1696].
  {panel}

You are not able to commit time estimates from Portfolio if time tracking is disabled on your JIRA instance.
While this is fairly expected (I would say), there should at least be an error/warning message describing this to the user.

Symptoms:
- Committing time based estimates will still result in no estimates being applied to the JIRA item, and will not be applied in Portfolio

Workaround:
- Enable time tracking as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-time-tracking-802593086.html]
fields.summary: Committing time estimates from Portfolio does not work properly with time tracking disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1695].
  {panel}

[JPO-66] had introduced mapping the "team" field to JIRA.  This is fantastic.  However, JQL only allows "=" and "in" operators.  They also don't accept EMPTY or NULL.

Also, getting this value in any scripting plug-in such as issue.get(“Team”) returns  com.atlassian.jpo.team.data.DefaultTeam.  This latter class is not exposed yet in the JIRA API.

The request is to be able to query this field for the scrum board filter for any issues that don't have a team assigned.  i.e. "project = XYZ and Team = EMPTY".   Alternatively, if the NULL/EMPTY value can't be returned, this could be written as "project = XYZ and Team not in (TeamA, TeamB, TeamC)".

Can this enhancement be considered or please indicate if there is a current workaround.

Thanks
fields.summary: Portfolio Team field has limited access from JQL within JIRA
Team field can be confused with Tempo Team field
